chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type

Goal:
enumerable__T X -> enumerable__T (list X)

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
enumerable__T = fun X : Type => exists f : nat -> option X, forall x : X, exists n : nat, f n = Some x : Type -> Prop Arguments enumerable__T _%type_scope
enumerable__T_sum : forall X Y : Type, enumerable__T X -> enumerable__T Y -> enumerable__T (X + Y)
enumerable__T_prod : forall X Y : Type, enumerable__T X -> enumerable__T Y -> enumerable__T (X * Y)
enumerable__T_option : forall X : Type, enumerable__T X -> enumerable__T (option X)
enum_enumT : forall X : Type, enumerable__T X < -> inhabited (enumT X)
enumerable_enumerable_T : forall X : Type, enumerable (fun _ : X => True) < -> enumerable__T X
Dis = fun X : Type => Dec2 eq : Type -> Type Arguments Dis _%type_scope
enumerable_nat_nat = ex_intro (fun f : nat -> option (nat * nat) => forall x : nat * nat, exists n : nat, f n = Some x) R_nat_nat pairs_retract : enumerable__T (nat * nat)
concat : forall A : Type, list (list A) -> list A
Tauto.TFormula = fun Term Annot TX AF : Type => Tauto.GFormula : Type -> Type -> Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.TFormula (_ _ _ _)%type_scope
count_nat = ex_intro (fun f : nat -> option nat => forall x : nat, exists n : nat, f n = Some x) Some (fun n : nat => ex_intro (fun n0 : nat => Some n0 = Some n) n eq_refl) : enumerable__T nat
Tauto.cnf_checker : forall Term' Annot Witness : Type, (list (Term' * Annot) -> Witness -> bool) -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot -> list Witness -> bool
Tauto.clause = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Term' * Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.clause (_ _)%type_scope
Tauto.cnf = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.cnf (_ _)%type_scope
select = fun X : Type => fix select (A : list nat) (B : list X) {struct A} : list X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => match nth B i with | Some x => x :: select A0 B | None => select A0 B end end : forall X : Type, list nat -> list X -> list X Arguments select {X}%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope
concat_filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list (list A)), concat [filter f p | p ∈ l] = filter f (concat l)
prod_enumerable : forall X Y : Type, enumT X -> enumT Y -> enumT (X * Y)
In_dec : forall X : Type, Dis X -> Dec2 (In (A:=X))
dec2 : forall p : ?X -> ?Y -> Prop, Dec2 p -> forall x : ?X, Dec1 (p x) where ?X : [X : Type |- Type] ?Y : [X : Type |- Type]
FinFun.Finite = fun A : Type => exists l : list A, FinFun.Full l : Type -> Prop Arguments FinFun.Finite _%type_scope
tab = fix tab (X : Type) (f : nat -> X) (k : nat) {struct k} : list X := match k with | 0 => [] | S n => tab X f n ++ [f n] end : forall X : Type, (nat -> X) -> nat -> list X Arguments tab {X}%type_scope _%function_scope _%nat_scope
ListDec.decidable_eq = fun A : Type => forall x y : A, Decidable.decidable (x = y) : Type -> Prop Arguments ListDec.decidable_eq _%type_scope
seteq = fun (X : Type) (A B : list X) => A ⊆ B /\ B ⊆ A : forall X : Type, list X -> list X -> Prop Arguments seteq {X}%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope
L_T = fun (X : Type) (enumT0 : enumT X) => let (L_T, _, _) := enumT0 in L_T : forall X : Type, enumT X -> nat -> list X Arguments L_T {X}%type_scope {enumT} _%nat_scope, _ {enumT} _
Tauto.GFormula_ind : forall P : Tauto.GFormula -> Prop, P Tauto.TT -> P Tauto.FF -> (forall t : ?TX, P (Tauto.X t)) -> (forall (t : ?TA) (a : ?AA), P (Tauto.A t a)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall g0 : Tauto.GFormula, P g0 -> P (Tauto.Cj g g0)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall g0 : Tauto.GFormula, P g0 -> P (Tauto.D g g0)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> P (Tauto.N g)) ->...-> forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g where ?TA : [X : Type |- Type] ?TX : [X : Type |- Type] ?AA : [X : Type |- Type] ?AF : [X : Type |- Type]
concat_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : list A) (l : list (list A)), concat (x :: l) = x ++ concat l
strict_incl = fun (X : Type) (A B : list X) => A ⊆ B /\ (exists x : X, x ∈ B /\ ~ x ∈ A) : forall X : Type, list X -> list X -> Prop Arguments strict_incl {X}%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope
enum = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (L : nat -> list X) => cumulative L /\ (forall x : X, p x <-> (exists m : nat, x ∈ L m)) : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> (nat -> list X) -> Prop Arguments enum {X}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
enumerable = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) => exists f : nat -> option X, forall x : X, p x < -> (exists n : nat, f n = Some x) : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments enumerable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
concat_nil_Forall : forall (A : Type) (l : list (list A)), concat l = [] < -> Forall (fun x : list A => x = []) l
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B Arguments prod (_ _)%type_scope Arguments pair {A B}%type_scope
